sub_title: Digital Inclusion and Economic Empowerment@World| Creating a new fossil free HOS for the Dutch & EU Region 🇳🇱 🇩🇪
summary:
Sagar is a 6th Gen. young social researcher, tech educator sustainable explorer & energy investment partner from NL & India Sub.

Studied M.S (Associate - Executive Degree) in Business & Data Science with Specialization in Energy & Sustainable Technologies at Harvard University., an M.S (Executive) in Finance & Negotiation at Yale University & M.Sc. degree in Management of Technology with Specialization in Entrepreneurship & Emerging Breakthrough Innovation at TU Delft, & Bachelors in Chemical & Biochemical Engg.

Previously he had been worked at Shell, Netherlands & London, Microsoft - Netherlands & Deloitte - the Edge Amsterdam. His recent association was with World Economic Forum, Netherlands, & Switzerland Sub as a Young Digital Associate.

Currently he manages GERIC LAB & work as a Joint Managing Director / Industrial Researcher at AASAN Group of companies - a family-owned business group of companies since 1988. Primarily focused over Large scale Industrial Management and Energy Audit, providing expertise over new renewable energy investments, sustainability & innovation tech solutions. As of now his current venture project is to create a next generation renewable energy park of ∞ MW to create a sustainable fossil free energy living source for the Indian Subcontinent. 

Over global scenario he has achieved many Awards/Recognition as listed below:

Finalist as Entrepreneur / Startup leader at Outstanding Leadership Awards 2022 - Australia
Nomine: Dutch Intrapreneur Award 2021 - NL
UN ECOSOC Youth Leader 2021 - NYC
Positive Change Ambassador - Erasmus Rotterdam University - April 2021 
Wall of Changemakers 2030 - Catalyst London
Antler's Copenhagen Founder's Program Feb Cohort 2022
Shortlisted @ World Startup Factory Scholarship Program 2021 | Rotterdam
Speaker @ World Sustainable Development Teach In Day - Hamburg
Winners @ Futurepreneurs Dutch Open 2020
Recognized as one of top 25 AI based Innovators @ Rockstart Accelerator AI 2019 - Netherlands
Finalist of Global Biomimicry Design Challenge 2018-19 - Minneapolis, USA
Winner of the worlds biggest Blockchain & AI Hackathon - Odyssey 2019 

At present he also creating a global level smart and intelligent sustainable farmhouse. A digital solution of exploration and people's life storyline through building up to tomorrow's food for today's future! A brief storyline of creating a fossil-free sustainable living for the dutch sub. - BDF 1.0

He also associated within other family run ventures such as: GERIC LAB, Habaple Partners, B'onwterp Labs, Spark Renewables LLP, Solwave Group of Companies.

The program inspires and teaches students how to start and run a business that can contribute to societal change. During the (free) 4 months program, you will work in teams on your own business idea or on a challenge that is brought in by a partner.

awards.title: My Visa Next Personality Award
awards.description: The following  report is generated by using thousands of data points from the assessment session. The game score is not considered from the individual psychometric profile; it is all about the unique approach to the scenarios presented. Based over the Arctic Shores assessments are grounded in validated personality and cognitive neuroscience frameworks and use the real behaviours to create a psychometric profile. The extensive research has shown this methodology to be a valid and reliable indicator of how you are likely to behave in the workplace.

awards.description:
UN Sustainabel Global Challenge: How can we empower children with disabilities so that they can have clear and customized representation in the toys they play with, in a sustainable manner?

Solution: BoomPowWOW Box is a system to adapt card and board games to improve children’s unseen super-powers.  

Partner: Medical Makers 
Representative: Dr. Julielynn Wong , (Harvard University - Physicist, Scientist and Innovator)

Reason to create the Idea! is  150 million kids worldwide have a disability or difference and they are not represented in the toy industry.

projects.title: Boom Pow Wow Idea! - EDIT: Expo for Design, Innovation & Technology, Toronto - Canada
projects.description:
Challenge: How can we empower children with disabilities so that they can have clear and customized representation in the toys they play with, in a sustainable manner?

Boom Pow Wow Idea! - BoomPowWOW Box is a system to adapt card and board games to improve children’s unseen super-powers. 

In partnering with the United Nations Development Programme on the inaugural edition of EDIT, the expo will demonstrate the true power of design by addressing the UNDP’s Global Goals for Sustainable Development and realizing our central theme of Prosperity for All (Nourish, Care, Shelter/Cities and Educate). We will inspire, inform, and connect participants and visitors through curated exhibits, immersive installations, a speakers series and more. 

The festival of the future - From September 28 to October 8 2017, Toronto (Canada) step inside a world where crickets can combat global hunger, medical supplies are 3D-printed in outer space, drones deliver blood to remote communities, and shipping containers are the future of farming.

projects.title: Erasmus Sustainability Days 2017
projects.description: In September 2015 the United Nations released the Sustainable Development Goals stressing the urgency to take action. Being more sustainable means taking into account the needs of today by not compromising the needs of future generations. Operating business as usual, this principle cannot be followed. Together with Erasmus Involved and its partnering organisations Green EUR, we present the second edition of the Erasmus Sustainability Days in 2017. Our goal is to engage students to become more familiar with sustainability and eventually inspire them to be part of the change.

projects.title: Thinking Strategically: Looking Ahead and Working Backward by Timothy Van Zandt
projects.description:
An interactive session where one can hone his skills in thinking strategically in dynamic environments: Moreover to make decisions today, we have to anticipate how will others react to our decisions, and for that we have to put ourselves in their shoes or more precisely, in their heads. 

Furthermore the discussion on How can commitment help one another, and how do we achieve commitment? Based on the work profile carried over through some fun puzzles and also some examples from business decisions. Here the usage of framework is mostly based on game theory and game trees.

Timothy Van Zandt is a Professor of Economics, Dean of Faculty & Research, Schroders Chaired Professor of European Competitiveness and Reform at INSEAD, The Business School for the world, France.

projects.title: Finance discussion: Can regulators fix bank culture and repair reputational damage? - Said Business School, Oxford University, London
projects.description:
a lively discussion between practitioners from leading organisations in finance and banking and members of the University of Oxford faculty, who will be tackling the topical question: can regulators fix bank culture and repair reputational damage?

The discussion will cover some of the following issues:

Is regulation actually the answer?
Why are banks singled out on cultural issues when there are plenty of examples of bad behaviour across other large corporate industries?
There is frequent talk about 'changing the culture' of the banking industry - but what do we actually want the culture to be?

Main Speakers would be: Alan Morrison, Rupert Younger, Nikhil Srinivasan , Terri Duhon , Robin Nuttall, and David Wighton.

projects.title: The Challenge Circular South Holland - Top 8 Finalists
projects.description:
At times when there are many renewable or residual energy is produced, is lost a lot of energy by too much energy on the market and on the network. At these times put Hydra Storage excess energy into hydrogen. The hydrogen is then stored, to be reconverted at times of energy shortage in energy. In addition, the generated hydrogen can be used for the refueling of hydrogen vehicles. Hydra Storage delivers a modular, easy to install and transport system. This allows decentralized hydrogen can be produced without high investments in infrastructure. Hydrogen is clean, to store a long and has a high energy density. In short, hydrogen is the future!

Selected as Top 8 Finalists during the challenge.

projects.title: Towards a green economy: pathways through politics, culture and economics'​ with Achim Steiner at Oxford Martin School, England
projects.description:
Drawing on his expertise as former Executive Director of the United Nations Environment Programme, Achim Steiner, Director of the Oxford Martin School, will present the latest trends and explore the varied challenges of a global transition towards an inclusive green economy. 

Achim Steiner - is an expert in environmental issues and politics. He was Executive Director of the United Nations Environment Programme UNEP from 2006 until June 2016. Director General of the International Union for Conservation of Nature (IUCN) and Secretary General of the World Commission on Dams. As of September 2016 he is director of the Oxford Martin School.

projects.title: Nanotechnology: A Responsible Innovation - A case study analysis
projects.description:
The aim of this paper is to provide the EU with an advice on whether spending a part of the R&D
budget on promoting responsible innovation in the field of nanotechnologies. In order to achieve
this aim, firstly three possible strategies for responsible innovation are analysed: anticipation,
reflectivity and inclusion. Afterwards it will be indicated the most and least promising ones and
why. In conclusion, motivations for funding or not expenditures for responsible innovation are
provided.

projects.title: Platform battle between hydrogen fuel cell and battery powered electric vehicles
projects.description:
Grade: 8.5

Conducting a research at Delft University of Technology that aims to evaluate the importance of factors for the market success of battery and fuel cell powered electric vehicles. under the guidance of Dr. Daniel Scholten, Dr. Geerten van de Kaa, and Dr. Jafar Rezaei at faculty of Technology, Policy and Management.

Research Question: What are the most important factors and why, to determine the winner in the ongoing platform battle between (hydrogen) fuel cell and battery powered electric vehicles?

projects.title: Smart Grids in Netherlands
projects.description:
Research Question: “What is the current state of developments in the area of smart grid in Netherlands?”

a. How can the Smart Grids in Netherlands be studied using the multi-level perspective and Strategic Niche Management (using its indicators) framework?
b. What factors contribute towards strengthening/ hampering the smart grid development?
c. Who are the key actors/ stakeholders in the Smart Grid development and implementation in Netherlands?
d. How do the stakeholders interact in the various levels of the socio-technical system? How did these interactions affect the development of smart grids?
e. How can we stimulate smart grid development and implementations?

@copyright of this study and information is not used before the permission of team members concern.

projects.title: Designed a new concept of simulation game for recruitment process for MOT graduate students for Integration moment course.
projects.description:
Grade: 8.3

"Tesla Tycoon" a game design on how to pick the right people out of all the applicants. Hereby we are focusing on a specific group: graduates of Management of Technology (MOT) at the Delft University of Technology. The design is specialized on applications for Supply Chain manager from the Logistic
department. Logistics are important for supply of materials for manufacturing together with distribution
of the final product: electrical vehicles.

Compared to, for example a regular job interview, the game can be more effective in assessing candidates’ different and unique skills. The design tests several capabilities and characteristics, which are important to identify suitable candidates for the job as Supply Chain manager. 

The entire setup for game design is divided into three different segments namely: First part is Reality in which Domain aspect, problem, factors and relationships are discussed, Second one is Meaning part in which purpose, strategy, operations, context are discussed. And the last third part which is Play worksheet where discussion about title and genre, goal, game play, game world, technology.

projects.title: Analysis of Toll Payment Process of Attica Tollway
projects.description:
Grade: 7

In most countries around the world, the general public objects to paying tolls. The main achievements of Attica Toll way concerning guaranteed travel times and smooth traffic flow conditions are important results in the development of toll roads in Greece because the project has changed public attitudes towards paying tolls. created the perception that PPPs are a good thing and confirmed that the user pays principle is socially fair. Providing an effective mechanism to measure continuously the level of service protecting the value of the toll paid by users, as well as to estimate the consequences of any action or decision to the value of the road. Also aiding the decision making process by giving it both forecasting assistance as well as monitoring capabilities. Setting a high standard of service level for itself and all the motorways in Greece. Furthermore, Attica tollway is probably the best proof that can demonstrate the success of this action. Despite the increase of daily traffic, the quality of customer service, high safety level and the innovations brought by the company are highly appreciated by the customers. With the continuous process improvement and technology innovation, Attica Toll way will be able to bring benefit to the more vehicle user, with greater value added experience.

profile_positions.description:
Aasan Group is one of the leading specialists in energy management and energy solution, have been serving industrial and commercial energy users as well as large energy companies since 1988. It is a family inheritance business group that is supporting a backbone of more than 800+ clientele over the sectors of manufacturing, industrial, and leading MNCs of Indian as well as European Continents. 

My work is mainly focused as a Researcher on new business developments, future international collaborations, multi - lateral diversification of businesses, project management of companies, and guidelines and support to get incentives subsidiaries from the government over small, medium and micro enterprises in all areas or work as technology and innovation level.

Along with that working as a Member / Researcher at AASAN Group - a next generation renewable energy park of 100 MW to create a sustainable fossil free energy living source for the Indian Subcontinent.

profile_positions.description:
Bees Digital Farm is a Dutch research startup that aims to develop the world’s first digital technology for in-house farming, providing tailor-made data-based solutions to make farming more sustainable. These 'digital farms' can be located all across the globe.

A research channel that focuses on building up a smart intelligent farmhouse of agro-based products like milk production, vegetables, & fruits within remote locations across the European Union with the help of cloud-based services like AI, blockchain, & data science. 

Creating an agro-based sustainable ecosystem for local farmers based in Germany & Netherlands within a digital data science technology like sustainable smart platforms, best inhouse farming methods, & best sustainable renewable energy lab that provides solutions with future tailor-made technology-based digital farms across the globe. 

For more information write to me at sagar.beesdigitalfarm@gmail.com or beesdigitalfarm@gmail.com

volunteer_experiences.description:
EYE is a European network of young engineering professionals and students sharing knowledge, fostering mobility, and developing personal and professional skills. A group of 350,000 + young fellow European engineers who want to change and support the world over sustainability, renewable energy, innovation, and technology. 

EYE is a dynamic and rapidly growing organization with enthusiastic members, presently consisting of 32 associations and representing more than 400’000 young engineers in Europe. EYE offers its member organizations and their students and young engineers access to a Europe-wide network by linking the engineering associations. More member associations are also expected to join in the near future.

volunteer_experiences.role: Internal Relations Onboarding Team / Management Team Member / Public Policy Associate

company.name: YES-Europe (Young leaders in Energy and Sustainability)

volunteer_experiences.description:
YES-Europe's vision of the future is a world where energy is more sustainable, accessible, and secure. Our role to make it happen is to build a stronger community of future energy leaders across disciplines and countries through online and in-person opportunities. We do it because we are certain that the only way to do it is together.

Check our new website: https://yeseurope.org/

YES-Europe grew out of an initiative at EPFL (Switzerland) that brought together 50 students from 9 European countries in May 2016 for the first YES-Europe Annual Conference to find ways to make a difference. Since then, a strategy team has been working to push further the development of the organization in more than 10 countries organizing local and international events.

My role at Yes Europe Germany is as a Board Member and Social Media & Communication Lead. As handling the social media pages, and creating the content and media highlights for Yes Europe Germany.

A WEAll Citizen is an individual who agrees that our economic system is not working fairly for everyone and that we need to put people in front of profit. WEAll are in this together. We value togetherness over the agreement and believe that if we are going to create global system change, we need to be collaborative and action-oriented.

https://wellbeingeconomy.org/citizens

It is a worldwide network of NGOs, social enterprises, intermediaries, funders, and other social change innovators, collaborating in this urgent moment to achieve the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs).

As a whole, we live in a unique era of human progress. Extreme poverty, malnutrition, violence, and infectious disease have plummeted, while life expectancy, literacy rates, and electricity access have soared. Yet, severe inequalities in income, health, education, and representation disadvantage billions around the world. Meanwhile, humanity’s growing ecological footprint is threatening many of the natural systems we all depend on—such as climate, oceans, land, biodiversity, and freshwater—which are nearing irreversible tipping points. These crises often intersect, creating conditions ripe for instability and conflict.

We may be the last generation alive that can act to reverse these trends. Catalyst 2030 believes that collective action and bold, new strategies are needed to address the crises of our time. Joining forces with communities, governments, businesses, and others, Catalyst 2030 members are working toward changing systems at all levels. Cumulatively, members have already impacted the lives of millions, often with limited resources. Together, we envision the realisation of the SDGs for all.

https://www.technologyreview.com/newsletter-preferences/

The purpose of initiating such a type of club is mainly considered on two factors as below mentioned:

1. To calculate carbon footprint for various day to day activities of an individual or an organization and then find and suggest measures to shorten (reduce) the footprint of an individual or an organization as a whole.

2. Also spread awareness among the students and people about the same and help to maintain planet green as a whole.

The initiating such type of club among the members of department of chemical engineering for up gradation of the students in many different courses which are available in chemical engineering course curriculum.

Became a Indian representative as Global citizens program held in Tomsk, Russia. The program was focused over the upliftment and importance over the English literature and language study to the High school kids and oral presentations for better improvement of the educational systems.
Help integration of international and Dutch students in the TU Delft by providing them an environment through buddy programs and student exchange weeks.
Worked as Energy Ambassador for Energy Club, Delft Energy Initiative to setup the Wind Energy Turbine at TU Delft Campus.
